Obama's chief of staff, Rahm Emanuel, had said this weekend that the Obama adminstration would not seek prosecution of the Bush administration lawyers. The president urged the hundreds of CIA employees who gathered in a secure auditorium to ignore the recent controversy. "Don't be discouraged by what's happened the last few weeks," he said. A round of cheers erupted when CIA Director Leon Panetta introduced Obama, who quickly reassured them that they had his backing. "I know the last few days have been difficult," he said.
